bibl.title: Territory of Washington v James Sheridan. Indictment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Indicment Pettit Larceny A True Bill
Witnesses S. B. Fargo C. L. Bridges Lieut Apperson
Territory of Washington } District Court Walla Walla County } First Judicial District
Territory of Washington Deft. vs James Sheridan Deft.

At a regular term of the District Court of the First Judicial District begun and held at Walla Wall concernly Territory of Washington the 27th day of April A. D. the grand jurors good and lawful man duly elected improneled and sworn charged to require in and for the county aforesaid on their so the present that James Sheridan late of Walla Walla county Territory of Washington of said County upon the Tenth day if April A. D. 1863 one revolver pistol of the value of sixteen dollars and of the personal goods and property of a soldier name unknown to the jurors aforesaid felioniously did did steel take and carry away contrary to the form and force of the statute in such above made and provided and the peace and dignity of the Territory of Washington W. G. Langford Pros. Atty.
